The traditional Polynesian tattoo, also known as "tatau," carries great cultural significance in Polynesian societies. The tattooing process is typically done by hand, using sharpened boar teeth, bone, or turtle shell tools. The process can be excruciatingly painful and may take several hours or even days to complete.
